TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Precision extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A class that defines the rounding precision to be used when formatting numbers in NumberFormatter.

remarks.para: A class that defines the rounding precision to be used when formatting numbers in NumberFormatter.
To create a Precision, use one of the factory methods.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Number.CurrencyPrecision Currency(class Android.Icu.Util.Currency/CurrencyUsage currencyUsage) cil managed
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Number.FractionPrecision FixedFraction(int32 minMaxFractionPlaces) cil managed

Docs.param: The minimum and maximum number of numerals to display after the decimal separator (rounding if too long or padding with zeros if too short).
Docs.summary: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of fraction places (numerals after the decimal separator).
Docs.returns: A FractionPrecision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

remarks.para: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of fraction places (numerals after the decimal separator). Additionally, pad with zeros to ensure that this number of places are always shown.
Example output with minMaxFractionPlaces = 3:
This method is equivalent to #minMaxFraction with both arguments equal.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Number.Precision FixedSignificantDigits(int32 minMaxSignificantDigits) cil managed

Docs.param: The minimum and maximum number of significant digits to display (rounding if too long or padding with zeros if too short).
Docs.summary: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of significant digits or significant figures.
Docs.returns: A Precision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

remarks.para: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of significant digits or significant figures. Additionally, pad with zeros to ensure that this number of significant digits/figures are always shown.
This method is equivalent to #minMaxSignificantDigits with both arguments equal.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Number.Precision Increment(class Java.Math.BigDecimal roundingIncrement) cil managed

Docs.param: The increment to which to round numbers.
Docs.summary: Show numbers rounded if necessary to the closest multiple of a certain rounding increment.
Docs.returns: A Precision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

remarks.para: Show numbers rounded if necessary to the closest multiple of a certain rounding increment. For example, if the rounding increment is 0.5, then round 1.2 to 1 and round 1.3 to 1.5.

In order to ensure that numbers are padded to the appropriate number of fraction places, set the scale on the rounding increment BigDecimal. For example, to round to the nearest 0.5 and always display 2 numerals after the decimal separator (to display 1.2 as "1.00" and 1.3 as "1.50"), you can run:
For more information on the scale of Java BigDecimal, see java.math.BigDecimal#scale().
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Show numbers rounded if necessary to the nearest integer.
Docs.returns: A FractionPrecision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

remarks.para: Show numbers rounded if necessary to the nearest integer.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Number.FractionPrecision MaxFraction(int32 maxFractionPlaces) cil managed

Docs.param: The maximum number of numerals to display after the decimal mark (rounding if necessary).
Docs.summary: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of fraction places (numerals after the decimal separator).
Docs.returns: A FractionPrecision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

remarks.para: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of fraction places (numerals after the decimal separator). Unlike the other fraction rounding strategies, this strategy does not pad zeros to the end of the number.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The maximum number of significant digits to display (rounding if too long).
Docs.summary: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of significant digits/figures.
Docs.returns: A Precision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

remarks.para: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of significant digits/figures.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Number.FractionPrecision MinFraction(int32 minFractionPlaces) cil managed

Docs.param: The minimum number of numerals to display after the decimal separator (padding with zeros if necessary).
Docs.summary: Always show at least a certain number of fraction places after the decimal separator, padding with zeros if necessary.
Docs.returns: A FractionPrecision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

remarks.para: Always show at least a certain number of fraction places after the decimal separator, padding with zeros if necessary. Do not perform rounding (display numbers to their full precision).
NOTE: If you are formatting doubles, see the performance note in #unlimited.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Show numbers rounded if necessary to a certain number of fraction places (numerals after the decimal separator); in addition, always show at least a certain number of places after the decimal separator, padding with zeros if necessary.
Docs.returns: A FractionPrecision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

The maximum number of significant digits to display (rounding if necessary).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Icu.Number.Precision TrailingZeroDisplay(class Android.Icu.Number.NumberFormatter/TrailingZeroDisplay trailingZeroDisplay) cil managed

abstract member TrailingZeroDisplay : Android.Icu.Number.NumberFormatter.TrailingZeroDisplay -> Android.Icu.Number.Precision override this.TrailingZeroDisplay : Android.Icu.Number.NumberFormatter.TrailingZeroDisplay -> Android.Icu.Number.Precision
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Number.Precision Unlimited() cil managed

Docs.summary: Show all available digits to full precision.
Docs.returns: A Precision for chaining or passing to the NumberFormatter precision() setter.

remarks.para: Show all available digits to full precision.

NOTE: When formatting a double, this method, along with #minFraction and #minSignificantDigits, will trigger complex algorithm similar to Dragon4 to determine the low-order digits and the number of digits to display based on the value of the double. If the number of fraction places or significant digits can be bounded, consider using #maxFraction or #maxSignificantDigits instead to maximize performance. For more information, read the following blog post.
http://www.serpentine.com/blog/2011/06/29/here-be-dragons-advances-in-problems-you-didnt-even-know-you-had/
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
